description: Now that he enters his high school career, Satomi Koutaro begins his life living alone in an apartment that only costs him 5000 yen per month, an extremely cheap deal even for this small apartment. There’s a catch: the apartment is apparently haunted by a cute ghost that has driven its prior occupants away. Next thing he knows, not only is there a ghost trying to drive him out of his new home, but magical girls and other unique female characters turn this small apartment into a battleground of sorts.
synonyms: ห้องเช่าป่วนก๊วนคนแปลก

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Card Battle
tags.description: Centers around individuals competing in card games.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

node.description:
[Website](https://www.universal-music.co.jp/petit-milady/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/petitmilady) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCXMlgSrADF3FEkbW5CEHj8g)

__Members:__ [Aoi Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101686) & [Ayana Taketatsu](https://anilist.co/staff/101996)

A voice actress duo unit. Together, they have performed the opening and ending themes for various anime, including the song "Kagami no Dual-ism", which was used as the third opening theme to [Yu-Gi-Oh! Zexal II](https://anilist.co/anime/15489/), the song "Azurite", which was used as the opening theme for [The Pilot's Love Song](https://anilist.co/anime/19117/), the song "Seishun wa Tabemono desu", used as the opening theme for [Pan de Peace](https://anilist.co/anime/21315/), the song "A or A!?", used as the opening theme for [Alice or Alice](https://anilist.co/anime/99638/).

The name of the unit is a reference to the fact that Aoi Yuuki and Ayana Taketatsu are small (their heights are 144.5 and 151 cm respectively) and cute girls.

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

__[Website](http://shogo.strikes.jp/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/shogoy)__

__Shougo Yasukawa__ is a Japanese script/screenwriter, series composer and lyricist.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/rsknkns)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/rsknkns/)__

Ryousuke Nakanishi is a Japanese composer, arranger, music producer and musician, while also known as the representative director of Altus Inc. and managing director Up Dream Inc. He is also a member of the Japanese Society for Rights of Authors, Composers and Publishers.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_silmeria_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_silmeria_/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/54631733)
Hideki Furukawa is an animator and animation director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/_silmeria_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_silmeria_/) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/54631733)
Hideki Furukawa is an animator and animation director.

**Height:** 152 cm

On October 17, 2023, she announced her marriage with music producer [Yunomi](https://anilist.co/staff/155750/Yunomi) via [Twitter.](https://twitter.com/nichika1015/status/1714101695633055776)

[Agency (Across Ent)](https://across-ent.com/talent/women/nichika_omori.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nichika1015) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nichika_omori) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3St-FyRoAvdgqeJA2EiKjw)

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=70) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maria_Naganawa) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E9%95%B7%E7%B8%84%E3%81%BE%E3%82%8A%E3%81%82) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/37071.html)

__Non-anime roles:__
- Natsu Yutori - Blue Archive (VG)
- Biscuit - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- [HuoHuo](https://anilist.co/character/350303) - Honkai: Star Rail (VG)
- Arisu Suzushima - O.N.G.E.K.I (VG)
- Wamdus - Granblue Fantasy (VG)

John Ledford is an entrepreneur and leader in the North American anime industry. In 1992, he founded A.D. Vision (ADV), paving the way for other businesses and the exponential growth anime has had within North America. With ADV's success, Ledford turned his sights to making the imaginative world of anime even more accessible with Anime Network's founding, North America’s first cable TV network dedicated to anime. He later partnered with Kadokawa Publishing and began Newtype USA with translated Japanese content and exclusive U.S. material related to all things anime, manga, and model reviews. This endeavor expanded into ADV Manga, which obtained licensing and publishing rights for hundreds of Japanese manga and Korean manhwa.

In 2008, Ledford founded a new anime-focused company called Sentai Filmworks (Sentai). Since its founding, Sentai provides thousands of hours of content across traditional and digital platforms. Sentai’s dedication to bringing captivating stories, including acclaimed titles such as Grave of the Fireflies, Ninja Scroll, and High School of the Dead to audiences, is ongoing.

Ledford’s most recent success is with the 2017 founding of the streaming service HIDIVE. Since launching, HIDIVE is now available via a web browser, mobile devices, gaming platforms, and more. HIDIVE offers new simulcasts every season, an ever-growing collection of dubs, and exclusive titles. The service features DUBCAST SM editions, early access local-language dubs of simulcasts directly produced by HIDIVE, as early as two weeks after the original Japanese broadcast.

For nearly thirty years now, Ledford continues his goal to further the expansion of anime and the Japanese culture as a whole.
